newsitem.title: USA: U.S. AID prices $1.0 bln in debt.
newsitem.headline: U.S. AID prices $1.0 bln in debt.

text.p: The U.S. Agency for International Development (AID) Thursday priced $1.0 billion in a multi-tranche debt offering for Israel via Lehman Brothers and Merrill Lynch & Co Inc, dealers said.
The first part of the deal consisted of $533.144 million of fixed rate four-tranche debt via sole manager Lehman Brothers.
-Class A: $150 million in notes due August 15, 1999. The notes have a coupon of 6.125 and were priced at 99.7584 to yield 6.2167 percent or 3.4 basis points over comparable U.S. Treasuries.
